repnme.cdata!: Tajikistan - Lake Sarez Risk Mitigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Tajikistan Lake Sarez
            Risk Mitigation Project were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: 1) importance of community involvement in
            disaster risk management and the positive impact of the
            parallel social components; 2) linking monitoring and
            evaluation (M&E) indicators with intended outcomes
            required qualitative data; 3) monitoring project
            implementation in remote and difficult areas was
            challenging; the importance of convening experts for
            advisory services; and 4) addressing institutional arrangements.

repnme.cdata!: Tajikistan - Lake Sarez Risk Mitigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Lake Sarez Risk Mitigation Project
            aims to help alert and prepare vulnerable people in case of
            a disaster associated with an outburst flood from Lake Sarez
            and other frequent natural hazards such as mudslides,
            rockfalls, avalanches, and seasonal floods. The project
            consists of four components. 1) The first component will
            design and install a monitoring system and an early warning
            system to safeguard the life of the communities located in
            the Murgab and Bartang valleys and to define a long-term
            strategy for Lake Sarez. 2) The second component will make
            the early warning system community-based and help
            communities prepare for a potential outburst flood form Lake
            Sarez as well as for small-scale natural disasters that
            occur frequently in the mountains by providing social
            training and safety-related supplies. 3) The third component
            will finance consultancy services to conduct studies of
            long-term solutions. 4) Institutional strengthening
            component will finance consultancy and equipment to
            strengthen the capabilities of the Sarez Agency and other
            units within the Ministry of Emergency Situations and Civil
            Defense, as well as the incremental operating costs
            associated with project management.
